item.title: Tricky got his Statement rong =(
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

public void PlayerIsAMember() { } if(ismember== 1); sendMessage("You are NOT a member - Please Subscribe"); disconnected = true; } else if(ismember== 0); sendMessage("Welcome Back "+playerName); }

Umm it should be like this:

public void PlayerIsAMember() {
if(ismember== 1) {
sendMessage("You are NOT a member - Please Subscribe");
disconnected = true;
}
else if(ismember== 0) {
sendMessage("Welcome Back "+playerName);
}
}

You had semi-colons after your if statements, plus you missed alot of brackets.

Read full topic

item.title: Tricky got his Statement rong =(
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

you must also create a membership system so the void knows what members are and who they are. its a bit more complicated than you think, but not that much more complicated. im not sure what to do, but with that void, you are saying that if the person is not a member, they get disconnected, and if they are, its welcome back…unless you already have a membership system, then add a line in that void to check it to see if they are a member or something like that.
